preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This manual describes the Remus audiostore, a software package to manage a set of audio files (MP3, Ogg, SID, etc). After reading this document you will know how to populate the audiostore, how to browse and search it, and how rename and remove files.

It contains descriptions of both the very high level interfaces to the store (e.g. WWW), and more low level (but perhaps more powerful) interfaces, such as database table layout, &app.python.link; interfaces, etc.

This book is split into two logically distinct sections. The first section, Using &project.nametag;, covers the installation and basic usage of &project.nametag;. It is expected that the reader will follow these chapters in sequence, possibly skipping chapters covering familiar topics. The second section, The Design of &project.nametag; discusses the internal software, what components are used, and how they interact.
To provide a consistent and easy to read text, several conventions are followed throughout the book.

listitem.para: An italic font is used for URLs, emphasized text, and the first usage of technical terms.
A monospaced font is used for error messages, commands, environment variables, names of ports, hostnames, user names, group names, device names, variables, and code fragments.
A bold font is used for applications, commands, and keys.
